changes.text: NZBHydra 2 can now run with Java 8, 9 or 10. It shouldn't matter much which version you use as long as it's up to date. If you want to use 9 or 10 you'll need to manually update the wrapper (i.e. the executable(s) in the main folder)
Reduced startup time. My instance starts in 8 seconds instead of 22 but YRMV
I updated the underlying libraries and main framework. This doesn't change much for you except that NZBHydra 2 is a bit more future proof and may have some new bugs :-)

Added an option to keep the history (searches, downloads, stats) only for a certain time (see Searching options). This may reduce the database size and stats calculation time and may improve performance a bit.
Hydra will correctly recognize if run in the windows program files folder

When shutting down or restarting Hydra will try to defrag the database file. In some cases this should drastically reduce the database size. It may grow again but for now I don't have a better fix than restarting the instance...
Remove multiple trailing words from titles if found
Adding new categories resulted in an exception
Increased the default XMX value to 256
Adding of downloaders to config was broken with last version
Redesigned the button to add new indexers. Inspired by Sonarr
When a torrent black hole is configured magnet links will be saved as files there. Let me know if you need a switch to disable that. Thanks to wh0cares
Config validation was not executed properly, sometimes allowing invalid values or even preventing the config from being changed
Added a small note to the readme that "linux" releases mean any platform but windows. Renaming the releases would break updates for running instances
Previous version was missing readme.md which resulted in broken updates
Small error in API? help from last version
Support animetosho (both newznab and torznab)
Add small 'API?' button in config to display newznab and torznab endpoints and the api key
Error with TMDB IDs introduced with last version

In some cases long running instances of Hydra use a lot of CPU when they should be idle. I've made some changes which should reduce the problem to a degree. Please let me know at https://github.com/theotherp/nzbhydra2/issues/96 if you have similar problems or, even better, if they've gone away with this version
Conversion of IMDB to TMDB ID failed with missing tt prefix
Prevent database error when ignoring too many updates...
Prevent rare database error when converting between movie IDs
Prevent API keys from leaking in debug infos ZIP when included in last error property
Option to disable download status updates. *Might* help in some rare cases where CPU usage is high when NZBHydra2 is supposed to idle
Log levels for console and file were not honored properly.

Updated the wrapper to create a memory dump file if the main process crashes when it's out of memory. As before you need to update the wrapper manually (except when you use docker and don't use the internal update mechanism). This is not strictly necessary but will improve chances of me debugging memory problems.
Bug in internal logic would throw exception and cause indexers to be disabled for no reason
API hit limit reached on omg would disable indexer permanently
Indexer config state would change when switching config tabs
Indexer priority field was not displayed in config
Prepend words in the results filter box with ! to exclude them
Shift-click for selecting multiple results in a row didn't work on firefox
Improve caps check for some results using a TV show's initialism instead of the full name in the title
Handle LL searches better that request a general category and a subcategory (e.g. 7000,7020)
Migration failed because of missing datatabase table
Allow configuration of basic auth credentials for jackett
Indexers with incomplete config were shown in selection list but not actually usable
Some issues with indexers not beeing reenabled and some confusing messages being shown. The whole thing with indexers being disabled after errors is still a bit wonky
Some potential memory leaks

Rewrote the display of indexer statuses. An indexer's status is now displayed in the indexer config section (where you would probably expect it). The 'Enabled' switch was extended and now will show one of the states 'Enabled', 'Temporarily disabled', 'Permanently disabled' or 'User disabled' and an explanation. THe Indexer statuses view does still show alle the indexers' statuses but is less cluttered
Show search results filter box in table header because some users didn't find the filter icons
Prevent weird 'Unexpected error in hydra code. Sorry...'
Improve conversion of newznab categories to internal categories
Exception in migration when providing no database file even when migration of database was requested
Allow loading of UI files from local folder to allow proper development of UI
Settings file was sometimes corrupted (wrong charset) and could not be loaded anymore
Delete error column in indexer status page when indexer is reenabled
Button to browse file system for selecting torrent folder would fail on some systems (e.g. docker)
Display serious errors on windows in message box
Hopefully reduced chance of empty config files being written
Handle duplicate results from indexers better (should rarely happen)

NZBHydra will recognize if it's running on windows and in folder like c:\program files or c:\program files (x86) and refuse to start. Those folders have special read/write rights which might cause some problems. I recommend putting any programs that are not installed by a setup in a "regular" folder
Experimental feature to use a packaged CA certs file. This probably doesn't concern you but it may solve some SSL related issues with some newer or different JREs
Sort indexer download shares by share
Made the migration process a tiny bit more robust wrt wrong input
Display caps check button for indexers without API key (e.g. spotweb instances). Hide button and search type and ID fields for new indexer. The check is done automatically
Sabnzbd history could not be properly parsed, preventing download status updates
Completely fix spotweb support...
Help headphones parse Hydra's results
Indexer connection check used empty API key parameter, preventing check to spotweb to work
Prevent session timeout

I've added debug logging to the wrapper for better, well, debugging of problems related to updating. To enable debug logging create a file DEBUG in the data folder and restart the program. As before, any non-docker installations will need to update the wrapper files manually. I'm working on a better solution.
Adding binsearch/NZBIndex/anizb would fail the connection check
Periodic check of downloader status was not executed as expected, resulting in incomplete status NZB reports in the history
Logger sometimes swallowed information when anonymizing data

I've changed how some data is kept in the database. Deleting an indexer will remove it completely from the database, also deleting all related stats, search results and downloads. This might take a while on the next startup or whenever you delete an indexer with many related entries
Option to delete backups after x weeks. 4 is the default
Improve layout on mobile devices. Thanks nemchik
Updated the wrapper to delete older JAR files which previously caused some trouble. Any existing installations will have to update this manually. Docker containers must be updated.
Send torrent magnet links to associated program
Results without recognizable category were rejected
Hide torrent black hole buttons for magnet links
Torrents were sometimes not correctly downloaded and would have extension .nzb
Fix NZB links not being constructed correctly. Sorry about that
Improved handling of XML generation for newznab/torznab API calls. Should improve compatibility with calling tools

Hydra attempts to recognize if it's running inside docker. It will not allow you call the internal update mechanism from the main page. You may still call it from the Updates page but a warning will be shown. Let me know if this works
The URL code change introduced with 1.1.0 might've caused some problems and should be fixed now
Sending NZBs from the download history to downloaders didn't work. You'll have to manually choose a category because the original category isn't available in the download history anymore
NZB filenames were not sanitized before being written to ZIP, resulting in an error
Improved dialog during update installation (no more error messages when everything is fine, hopefully)
Download history was not filterable by indexer
SickBeard/-rage/Medusa did not find all relevant categories. I've changed the way Hydra reports itscategories to calling tools. It follows the predefined categories of the newznab standard.
Fix results not being recognized by SickRage
The URL code change introduced with 1.1.0 might've caused some problems and should be fixed now

Completely rewrote handling of scheme, port, host and context path. Should solve some issues and prevent others from happening where reverse proxies are involved. Also extended the Wiki. There's no need to set an external URL anymore. Please report back if this causes any issues

I'll remove the option to send links to downloaders in one of the coming versions. Only upload of NZBs to downloaders will be supported. v2 is capable of handling it without issues and it allows for better control and upload status recognition
Remove test data left in by mistake
Don't require restart for change of log level
Show status updates during update
In some cases restarting resulted in shutdown. If you are affected by this you will to manually update the wrapper from this release
In some cases duplicate detection would throw an exception
Support JSON output for API searches
Make sure users don't enter an insane download limit value
Fix forbidden regexes which might've let some results through
Add option to disable CSRF protection and disable it by default
Pull NZB download status from configured downloaders instead of relying on extension scripts
Add button to check caps for all/all incomplete (yellow) indexers
Anonymize username:password pairs in URLs in logs
Torznab results were returned wrong, preventing Hydra from being added to radarr
Gracefully shutdown when restarting or quitting while search requests are handled
NZBs proxied from indexers were returned with wrong / random seeming file name
Allow migrating only the config, skipping the database migration
Fix error in auth introduced in a previous version
Improve the logging for web exceptions (which are often swallowed which makes debugging harder)
Name of the category would not update in the category dropdown box on the search page
Allow searching without a query in the UI
Allow NZBHydra2 to be shown in an iFrame (e.g. organizr)
Increase lengths for columns which may contain very long texts (errors, queries)
Fix bug in wrapper that I introduced in last version. Oh well...
Improve the way the host is determined. External URL should not need to be set when not using a reverse proxy
Remove PyYAML dependency from wrapper
Make migration a bit more stable
Make sure wrapper is started from correct folder
So many fixes
So many fixes
First public release. Welcome!
